parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Config

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Check if config entry represents config class.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Boolean]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''isClass''' config
</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> config: [[Config]]
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>_ok = [[isClass]] ([[configFile]] [[gtgt|>>]] "CfgVehicles");</code> Result is [[true]].

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[configFile]], [[config / name]], [[configName]], [[count]], [[getArray]], [[getText]], [[getNumber]], [[inheritsFrom]], [[isArray]], [[isNumber]], [[isText]], [[select]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on March 2, 2007 - 01:17</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]<dd class="note">This command allows you to check for the presence of an addon.
 isClass (configFile >> "cfgVehicles" >> "MyCustomCar") 
will return [[true]] if the addon "MyCustomCar" is installed, and [[false]] if it is not installed. 

''You will have to know under which class the addon is categorized (in this case "cfgVehicles") to be able to use the right config path.''
<dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 31, 2014 - 15:45</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
(<template><title>arma3</title></template> ver 1.14) According to BI Dev Karel Mořický, [[BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass]] provides a comfortable workaround with custom config under description.ext compared with [[isClass]]. (But as a function created specifically for A3 campaign, it is in no way intended as a replacement for [[isClass]]. So it is not suggested to use it for [[configFile]] classes. But [[isClass]] instead.)
E.g.
<code>["Something1","Something2","Something3"] call bis_fnc_getCfgIsClass<br> //Same as isClass (missionconfigfile >> "Something1" >> "Something2" >> "Something3")</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
